page.title: 18The Viewpark Market
page.content: Every Wednesday the market comes to Viewpark. Other days it is in Bellshill or Glasgow. You can always smell the hot dogs as you go down. There are the shouts about goods and prices. The vegetable and the clothes stalls are the busiest. Even when it is wet and rainy there are still a few customers attracted to the market. When the weather is fine the place is always packed, especially during the summer holidays. The old, cheery lady shouts to buy her sweets and never mind the teeth;the fruit and veg. man says come and get your tropical fruits here. The jewellery stall catches the sun-light. The market is a popular place with shoppers both happy and grumpy, look- ing for bargains.
